segment.source: Overview of the Tools in DaRT 8.0
segment.target: Overview of the Tools in DaRT 8.0

segment.source: Overview of the Tools in DaRT 8.0
segment.target: Overview of the Tools in DaRT 8.0

segment.source: Overview of the Tools in DaRT 8.0
segment.target: Overview of the Tools in DaRT 8.0

segment.source: From the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window in Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 8.0, you can start any of the individual tools that you include when you create the DaRT 8.0 recovery image.
segment.target: From the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window in Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 8.0, you can start any of the individual tools that you include when you create the DaRT 8.0 recovery image.

segment.source: For information about how to access the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window, see How to Recover Local Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image.
segment.target: For information about how to access the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window, see How to Recover Local Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image.

segment.source: If it is available, you can use the Solution Wizard on the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window to select the tool that best addresses your particular issue, based on a brief interview that the wizard provides.
segment.target: If it is available, you can use the Solution Wizard on the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window to select the tool that best addresses your particular issue, based on a brief interview that the wizard provides.

segment.source: Exploring the DaRT tools
segment.target: Exploring the DaRT tools

segment.source: A description of the DaRT 8.0 tools follows.
segment.target: A description of the DaRT 8.0 tools follows.

segment.source: Computer Management
segment.target: Computer Management

segment.source: Computer Management is a collection of Windows administrative tools that help you troubleshoot a problem computer.
segment.target: Computer Management is a collection of Windows administrative tools that help you troubleshoot a problem computer.

segment.source: You can use the Computer Management tools in DaRT to view system information and event logs, manage disks, list autoruns, and manage services and drivers.
segment.target: You can use the Computer Management tools in DaRT to view system information and event logs, manage disks, list autoruns, and manage services and drivers.

segment.source: The Computer Management console is customized to help you diagnose and repair problems that might be preventing the Windows operating system from starting.
segment.target: The Computer Management console is customized to help you diagnose and repair problems that might be preventing the Windows operating system from starting.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The recovery of dynamic disks with DaRT is not supported.
segment.target: The recovery of dynamic disks with DaRT is not supported.

segment.source: Crash Analyzer
segment.target: Crash Analyzer

segment.source: Use the Crash Analyzer Wizard to quickly determine the cause of a computer failure by analyzing the memory dump file on the Windows operating system that you are repairing.
segment.target: Use the Crash Analyzer Wizard to quickly determine the cause of a computer failure by analyzing the memory dump file on the Windows operating system that you are repairing.

segment.source: Crash Analyzer examines the memory dump file for the driver that caused a computer to fail.
segment.target: Crash Analyzer examines the memory dump file for the driver that caused a computer to fail.

segment.source: You can then disable the problem device driver by using the Services and Drivers node in the Computer Management tool.
segment.target: You can then disable the problem device driver by using the Services and Drivers node in the Computer Management tool.

segment.source: The Crash Analyzer Wizard requires the Debugging Tools for Windows and symbol files for the operating system that you are repairing.
segment.target: The Crash Analyzer Wizard requires the Debugging Tools for Windows and symbol files for the operating system that you are repairing.

segment.source: You can include both requirements when you create the DaRT recovery image.
segment.target: You can include both requirements when you create the DaRT recovery image.

segment.source: If they are not included on the recovery image and you do not have access to them on the computer that you are repairing, you can copy the memory dump file to another computer and use the stand-alone version of Crash Analyzer to diagnose the problem.
segment.target: If they are not included on the recovery image and you do not have access to them on the computer that you are repairing, you can copy the memory dump file to another computer and use the stand-alone version of Crash Analyzer to diagnose the problem.

segment.source: Running Crash Analyzer is a good idea even if you plan to reimage the computer.
segment.target: Running Crash Analyzer is a good idea even if you plan to reimage the computer.

segment.source: The image could have a defective driver that is causing problems in your environment.
segment.target: The image could have a defective driver that is causing problems in your environment.

segment.source: By running Crash Analyzer, you can identify problem drivers and improve the image stability.
segment.target: By running Crash Analyzer, you can identify problem drivers and improve the image stability.

segment.source: For more information about Crash Analyzer, see Diagnosing System Failures with Crash Analyzer.
segment.target: For more information about Crash Analyzer, see Diagnosing System Failures with Crash Analyzer.

segment.source: Defender
segment.target: Defender

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Environments with the DaRT Defender deployed should instead use the Windows Defender Offline (WDO) protection image for malware detection.
segment.target: Environments with the DaRT Defender deployed should instead use the Windows Defender Offline (WDO) protection image for malware detection.

segment.source: Because of how the Defender tool integrates into DaRT, all supported DaRT version deployments cannot apply these anti-malware updates to their DaRT images.
segment.target: Because of how the Defender tool integrates into DaRT, all supported DaRT version deployments cannot apply these anti-malware updates to their DaRT images.

segment.source: For more information, see Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) users should use Windows Defender Offline (WDO) for malware detection.
segment.target: For more information, see Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) users should use Windows Defender Offline (WDO) for malware detection.

segment.source: Defender can help detect malware and unwanted software and warn you of security risks.
segment.target: Defender can help detect malware and unwanted software and warn you of security risks.

segment.source: You can use this tool to scan a computer for and remove malware even when the installed Windows operating system is not running.
segment.target: You can use this tool to scan a computer for and remove malware even when the installed Windows operating system is not running.

segment.source: When Defender detects malicious or unwanted software, it prompts you to remove, quarantine, or allow for each item.
segment.target: When Defender detects malicious or unwanted software, it prompts you to remove, quarantine, or allow for each item.

segment.source: Malware that uses rootkits can mask itself from the running operating system.
segment.target: Malware that uses rootkits can mask itself from the running operating system.

segment.source: If a rootkit-enabled virus or spyware is in a computer, most real-time scanning and removal tools can no longer see it or remove it.
segment.target: If a rootkit-enabled virus or spyware is in a computer, most real-time scanning and removal tools can no longer see it or remove it.

segment.source: Because you boot the problem computer into DaRT and the installed operating system is offline, you can detect the rootkit without it being able to mask itself.
segment.target: Because you boot the problem computer into DaRT and the installed operating system is offline, you can detect the rootkit without it being able to mask itself.

segment.source: Disk Commander
segment.target: Disk Commander

segment.source: Disk Commander lets you recover and repair disk partitions or volumes by using one of the following recovery processes:
segment.target: Disk Commander lets you recover and repair disk partitions or volumes by using one of the following recovery processes:

segment.source: Restore the master boot record (MBR)
segment.target: Restore the master boot record (MBR)

segment.source: Recover one or more lost volumes
segment.target: Recover one or more lost volumes

segment.source: Restore partition tables from Disk Commander backup
segment.target: Restore partition tables from Disk Commander backup

segment.source: Save partition tables to Disk Commander backup
segment.target: Save partition tables to Disk Commander backup

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: We recommend that you back up a disk before you use Disk Commander to repair it.
segment.target: We recommend that you back up a disk before you use Disk Commander to repair it.

segment.source: By using Disk Commander, you can potentially damage volumes and make them inaccessible.
segment.target: By using Disk Commander, you can potentially damage volumes and make them inaccessible.

segment.source: Additionally, changes to one volume can affect other volumes because volumes on a disk share a partition table.
segment.target: Additionally, changes to one volume can affect other volumes because volumes on a disk share a partition table.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The recovery of dynamic disks with DaRT is not supported.
segment.target: The recovery of dynamic disks with DaRT is not supported.

segment.source: Disk Wipe
segment.target: Disk Wipe

segment.source: You can use Disk Wipe to delete all data from a disk or volume, even the data that is left behind after you reformat a hard disk drive.
segment.target: You can use Disk Wipe to delete all data from a disk or volume, even the data that is left behind after you reformat a hard disk drive.

segment.source: Disk Wipe lets you select from either a single-pass overwrite or a four-pass overwrite, which meets current U.S. Department of Defense standards.
segment.target: Disk Wipe lets you select from either a single-pass overwrite or a four-pass overwrite, which meets current U.S. Department of Defense standards.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: After wiping a disk or volume, you cannot recover the data.
segment.target: After wiping a disk or volume, you cannot recover the data.

segment.source: Verify the size and label of a volume before erasing it.
segment.target: Verify the size and label of a volume before erasing it.

segment.source: Explorer
segment.target: Explorer

segment.source: The Explorer tool lets you browse the computer’s file system and network shares so that you can remove important data that the user stored on the local drive before you try to repair or reimage the computer.
segment.target: The Explorer tool lets you browse the computer’s file system and network shares so that you can remove important data that the user stored on the local drive before you try to repair or reimage the computer.

segment.source: And because you can map drive letters to network shares, you can easily copy and move files from the computer to the network for safekeeping or from the network to the computer to restore them.
segment.target: And because you can map drive letters to network shares, you can easily copy and move files from the computer to the network for safekeeping or from the network to the computer to restore them.

segment.source: File Restore
segment.target: File Restore

segment.source: File Restore lets you try to restore files that were accidentally deleted or that were too big to fit in the Recycle Bin.
segment.target: File Restore lets you try to restore files that were accidentally deleted or that were too big to fit in the Recycle Bin.

segment.source: File Restore is not limited to regular disk volumes, but can find and restore files on lost volumes or on volumes that are encrypted by BitLocker.
segment.target: File Restore is not limited to regular disk volumes, but can find and restore files on lost volumes or on volumes that are encrypted by BitLocker.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The recovery of dynamic disks with DaRT is not supported.
segment.target: The recovery of dynamic disks with DaRT is not supported.

segment.source: File Search
segment.target: File Search

segment.source: Before reimaging a computer, recovering files from the local hard disk is important, especially when the user might not have backed up or stored the files elsewhere.
segment.target: Before reimaging a computer, recovering files from the local hard disk is important, especially when the user might not have backed up or stored the files elsewhere.

segment.source: The Search tool opens a File Search window that you can use to find documents when you do not know the file path or to search for general kinds of files across all local hard disks.
segment.target: The Search tool opens a File Search window that you can use to find documents when you do not know the file path or to search for general kinds of files across all local hard disks.

segment.source: You can search for specific file-name patterns in specific paths.
segment.target: You can search for specific file-name patterns in specific paths.

segment.source: You can also limit results to a date range or size range.
segment.target: You can also limit results to a date range or size range.

segment.source: Hotfix Uninstall
segment.target: Hotfix Uninstall

segment.source: The Hotfix Uninstall Wizard lets you remove hotfixes or service packs from the Windows operating system on the computer that you are repairing.
segment.target: The Hotfix Uninstall Wizard lets you remove hotfixes or service packs from the Windows operating system on the computer that you are repairing.

segment.source: Use this tool when a hotfix or service pack is suspected in preventing the operating system from starting.
segment.target: Use this tool when a hotfix or service pack is suspected in preventing the operating system from starting.

segment.source: We recommend that you uninstall only one hotfix at a time, even though the tool lets you uninstall more than one.
segment.target: We recommend that you uninstall only one hotfix at a time, even though the tool lets you uninstall more than one.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Programs that were installed or updated after a hotfix was installed might not work correctly after you uninstall a hotfix.
segment.target: Programs that were installed or updated after a hotfix was installed might not work correctly after you uninstall a hotfix.

segment.source: Locksmith
segment.target: Locksmith

segment.source: The Locksmith Wizard lets you set or change the password for any local account on the Windows operating system that you are analyzing or repairing.
segment.target: The Locksmith Wizard lets you set or change the password for any local account on the Windows operating system that you are analyzing or repairing.

segment.source: You do not have to know the current password.
segment.target: You do not have to know the current password.

segment.source: However, the password that you set must comply with any requirements that are defined by a local Group Policy Object.
segment.target: However, the password that you set must comply with any requirements that are defined by a local Group Policy Object.

segment.source: This includes password length and complexity.
segment.target: This includes password length and complexity.

segment.source: You can use Locksmith when the password for a local account, such as the local Administrator account, is unknown.
segment.target: You can use Locksmith when the password for a local account, such as the local Administrator account, is unknown.

segment.source: You cannot use Locksmith to set passwords for domain accounts.
segment.target: You cannot use Locksmith to set passwords for domain accounts.

segment.source: Registry Editor
segment.target: Registry Editor

segment.source: You can use Registry Editor to access and change the registry of the Windows operating system that you are analyzing or repairing.
segment.target: You can use Registry Editor to access and change the registry of the Windows operating system that you are analyzing or repairing.

segment.source: This includes adding, removing, and editing keys and values, and importing registry (.reg) files.
segment.target: This includes adding, removing, and editing keys and values, and importing registry (.reg) files.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: Serious problems can occur if you change the registry incorrectly by using Registry Editor.
segment.target: Serious problems can occur if you change the registry incorrectly by using Registry Editor.

segment.source: These problems might require you to reinstall the operating system.
segment.target: These problems might require you to reinstall the operating system.

segment.source: Before you make changes to the registry, you should back up any valued data on the computer.
segment.target: Before you make changes to the registry, you should back up any valued data on the computer.

segment.source: Change the registry at your own risk.
segment.target: Change the registry at your own risk.

segment.source: SFC Scan
segment.target: SFC Scan

segment.source: The SFC Scan tool starts the System File Repair Wizard and lets you repair system files that are preventing the installed Windows operating system from starting.
segment.target: The SFC Scan tool starts the System File Repair Wizard and lets you repair system files that are preventing the installed Windows operating system from starting.

segment.source: The System File Repair Wizard can automatically repair system files that are corrupted or missing, or it can prompt you before it performs any repairs.
segment.target: The System File Repair Wizard can automatically repair system files that are corrupted or missing, or it can prompt you before it performs any repairs.

segment.source: Solution Wizard
segment.target: Solution Wizard

segment.source: The Solution Wizard presents a series of questions and then recommends the best tool for the situation, based on your answers.
segment.target: The Solution Wizard presents a series of questions and then recommends the best tool for the situation, based on your answers.

segment.source: This wizard helps you determine which tool to use when you are not familiar with the tools in DaRT.
segment.target: This wizard helps you determine which tool to use when you are not familiar with the tools in DaRT.

segment.source: TCP/IP Config
segment.target: TCP/IP Config

segment.source: When you boot a problem computer into DaRT, it is set to automatically obtain its TCP/IP configuration (IP address and DNS server) from Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP).
segment.target: When you boot a problem computer into DaRT, it is set to automatically obtain its TCP/IP configuration (IP address and DNS server) from Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP).

segment.source: If DHCP is unavailable, you can manually configure TCP/IP by using the TCP/IP Config tool.
segment.target: If DHCP is unavailable, you can manually configure TCP/IP by using the TCP/IP Config tool.

segment.source: You first select a network adapter, and then configure the IP address and DNS server for that adapter.
segment.target: You first select a network adapter, and then configure the IP address and DNS server for that adapter.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Getting Started with DaRT 8.0
